channel.title: Zikang Tong on SUPER-Lab
channel.description: Recent content in Zikang Tong on SUPER-Lab

item.title: SiC, GaN and Si technology comparison for high power RF plasma generators
item.description: Figure 1: Electrostatic potential contours under large-signal excitation at 1 MHz. (a) Deep buffer traps added at 0.98 eV. (b) Shallow buffer traps added at 0.5 eV. Summary We are studying the electric properties of SiC and GaN devices to design high power, high frequency RF plasma generators

item.title: The modeling and understanding high frequency losses in SiC and GaN devices
item.description: Figure 1: Electrostatic potential contours under large-signal excitation at 1 MHz. (a) Deep buffer traps added at 0.98 eV. (b) Shallow buffer traps added at 0.5 eV. Small- and Large-Signal Dynamic Output Capacitance and Energy Loss in GaN-on-Si Power HEMTs The origin of Coss and the energy dissipation due to output capacitance can be roughly separated into two types: resistive loss and capacitive hysteresis loss. The resistive losses are due to the resistance of gallium nitride (GaN) buffer layers and Si-substrate.

item.title: Origins of Soft-switching Coss Losses in SiC Power MOSFETs and Diodes for Resonant Converter Applications
item.description: The recent development and commercialization of wide bandgap (WBG) power semiconductors, specifically gallium nitride (GaN) and silicon carbide (SiC), has driven the increase in switching frequency for soft-switching power converters like the Class E, Class Î¦2, and Class DE resonant inverters and rectifiers. However, prior literature has characterized numerous commercial GaN and SiC devices using the Sawyer-Tower circuit and discovered significant large-signal charge-voltage hysteresis of the Coss.

item.title: Design and Fabrication of Three-Dimensional Printed Air-Core Transformers for High-Frequency Power Applications
item.description: This article presents various designs of toroidal air-core transformers utilizing a 3-D printing and electroplating fabrication methodology.
